intro: Tetratheca subaphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southwestern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Tetratheca subaphylla is an important species for local biodiversity and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands.
